docs.lead_paragraph: Federal health officials have approved a daily pill that can cure the most common form of hepatitis C without the grueling pill-and-injection cocktail long used to treat the virus.

headline.main: New Once-a-Day Pill for Hepatitis C Wins FDA OK
headline.print_headline: New Once-a-Day Pill for Hepatitis C Wins FDA OK

docs.snippet: Federal health officials have approved a daily pill that can cure the most common form of hepatitis C without the grueling pill-and-injection cocktail long used to treat the virus.

docs.lead_paragraph: Leading companies offering medical evacuation services are drawing a line at flying Ebola patients out of West Africa for treatment abroad as the cost and the complexities of the deadly epidemic grow.

headline.main: Medical Evacuation Services Draw Line at Flying Out Ebola Patients
headline.print_headline: Medical Evacuation Services Draw Line at Flying Out Ebola Patients

docs.snippet: Leading companies offering medical evacuation services are drawing a line at flying Ebola patients out of West Africa for treatment abroad as the cost and the complexities of the deadly epidemic grow.

docs.lead_paragraph: Carl Icahn accused New Jersey's Senate president of "selling out" Atlantic City by considering casinos near New York City, while the legislative leader said the state wouldn't give the billionaire investor the tax breaks he is seeking.

headline.main: Icahn: Senate Leader 'Selling Out' Atlantic City
headline.print_headline: Icahn: Senate Leader 'Selling Out' Atlantic City

docs.snippet: Carl Icahn accused New Jersey's Senate president of "selling out" Atlantic City by considering casinos near New York City, while the legislative leader said the state wouldn't give the billionaire investor the tax breaks he is seeking.

docs.lead_paragraph: Todd Gurley was emerging as the clear favorite in the Heisman Trophy race, a running back who already produced plenty of signature moments with his myriad talents.
docs.snippet: Todd Gurley was emerging as the clear favorite in the Heisman Trophy race, a running back who already produced plenty of signature moments with his myriad talents.

docs.lead_paragraph: Stories of racial discrimination by Texas workers seeking compensation for injuries cannot be analyzed because the Division of Workers’ Compensation has not collected data on race for several years.

headline.main: Injury Statistics by Race Go Uncollected
headline.print_headline: Injury Statistics by Race Goes Uncollected

docs.snippet: Stories of racial discrimination by Texas workers seeking compensation for injuries cannot be analyzed because the Division of Workers’ Compensation has not collected data on race for several years.

docs.lead_paragraph: Debt scolds hate good fiscal news so much that most Americans haven’t heard that the deficit plunge of the past several years continues.
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column examines why there has been so little fanfare surrounding fact that deficit has fallen significantly and continues to fall; blames news media coverage of deficit, which plays up bad news and downplays good news, if it is reported at all; criticizes deficit scolds, who in fact love big budget deficits because fears of fiscal crisis are their best hope of getting big cuts in social programs, which is their ultimate goal.
docs.snippet: Debt scolds hate good fiscal news so much that most Americans haven’t heard that the deficit plunge of the past several years continues.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Progressive spending, not taxes, is the key to reducing inequality.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Edward D Kleinbard contends addressing income inequality in America through tax structure is wrong way to think about the issue; calls for a progressive fiscal system, which would encompass both the tax and spending sides of government.
docs.snippet: Progressive spending, not taxes, is the key to reducing inequality.

docs.lead_paragraph: Results of surveys suggest that people understand Medicaid’s drawbacks but appreciate its advantages.

headline.main: Medicaid, Often Criticized, Is Quite Popular With Its Customers

docs.snippet: Results of surveys suggest that people understand Medicaid’s drawbacks but appreciate its advantages.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Dallas hospital that treated the Ebola patient who died this week tried to fend off accusations on Thursday that it initially turned him away because he was a poor African immigrant without insurance.

headline.main: Texas Hospital Defends Itself Over Treatment of Ebola Patient
headline.print_headline: Texas Hospital Defends Itself Over Treatment of Ebola Patient

docs.snippet: The Dallas hospital that treated the Ebola patient who died this week tried to fend off accusations on Thursday that it initially turned him away because he was a poor African immigrant without insurance.

docs.lead_paragraph: Yet another mistake by Oregon's troubled health insurance exchange is coming to light: The state mistakenly enrolled a U.S. senator in Medicaid, the health insurance plan for the poor.

headline.main: Cover Oregon Mistake Enrolls Senator in Medicaid
headline.print_headline: Cover Oregon Mistake Enrolls Senator in Medicaid

docs.snippet: Yet another mistake by Oregon's troubled health insurance exchange is coming to light: The state mistakenly enrolled a U.S. senator in Medicaid, the health insurance plan for the poor.
